column4: no it is not a hardware problem this works perfect even on ubuntu before
i mean there has to be  a way or an explanation NewWorld
ok i can leave it half way but that does not seem to be a solution
as it can be on but not recognized
it is as if ubuntu is lazy recognizing hardware, i think there have been times when i plug after a while and it recognizes it again
anyone knows what command to run to make ubuntu look for mouse on usb?
anyone knows how ubuntu recognizes hardwre on the usb ports?
why is it not working the way it should
if it is dead then why when i reboot it always works
sorry my internet died. Run dmesg and plug in the mouse , paste output
Now pull it out and paste output. For me it states my mouse disconnected
I think it may be a hardware problem
Probably in the mouse, but I guess maybe the USB slot. Like the contact is bad so the electricity doesn't flow
If you want to be sure, try it on another machine
It's not uncommon. I had 2 logitech mice die. Before they died, they only worked if you positioned the wire in a special way
